<h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center
column2: >SON OF A JOHN…YOUR NEW GO TO HOT SAUCE!

column1: I have designed these sauces to be HOT, but most importantly, to TASTE GOOD! We make the best tasting, most edible hot sauces that money can buy. All our sauces have heat AND are something that you actually crave to put on your food.

Son Of A John was an unexpected arrival that began life as a long term project to grow Japanese Maple trees. I also started growing a garden in the back yard - because homegrown vegetables are undisputedly the best!  With dreams of bountiful harvests, I planted my garden…and along with the tomatoes, carrots, and everything else, I planted WAY too many peppers. My veggies needed to drink and I gave them rainwater. They needed to eat too, and I became a worm farmer so they had good organic fertilizer. They thrived and produced – a LOT.  What to do with all those peppers? HOT SAUCE!!! I went into the kitchen and developed my first hot sauce recipe, Light My Fire…and it was good! Very good! Thus, Son Of A John was born – the best tasting (HOT) hot sauces in the South!

Being a good cook and liking to share, I began giving bottles to friends and family.  I got rave reviews from everyone on my first sauce and went back to the kitchen to create the next two even hotter sauces, Smokin’ Ghost and Ant Bite – both of which turned out just as tasty as the first…full of flavor and just as fantastic, if not BETTER!

People were trying to give me money for bottles to take to their friends and family, and more than one person told me I should start selling them because they really are THAT good! At this stage, I realize I have a knack for what I am doing. I have sold individual bottles and 3 bottle sets, which are a big time hit!  Everyone loves them!  Now, people are buying cases instead of bottles.  There is hot sauce everywhere!!  To keep up with the demand, it is time to get some help and work with a co-packer because Son Of A John has now outgrown my kitchen.
<h3><strong>What We Need &amp

I need to raise $15,000 to cover the costs of product analysis in a lab, product development costs, the printed labels with nutritional content and UPC and QR codes, and the first official run for each flavor totaling 150 gallons. I am set up to accommodate on-line sales and have ties to restaurants, bars, distributors and grocery stores to get these sauces on your table (and they are asking!!). I truly appreciate everyone who helps me kick this project up to the next level.

In exchange for your generous contributions to keep up with demand, we have some great perk packages where you can pre-order your choice of sauces in 1, 2, 3, or 12 quantities with no added shipping cost!! We are also working on getting stickers, t-shirts and some other cool stuff that we will add on as they become available.

Light My Fire- Made with habañero peppers and a unique blend of spices, this sauce is hot, sweet and smoky. Perfect for wings, pork, and just about any meat where you want to kick things up a notch! Goes great on a ton of other stuff too, so use your imaginations and your taste buds!

Smokin' Ghost - NOT for lightweights when it comes to hot sauces! This perfect blend of habañero and ghost peppers is rich and smooth with a big bite! The roasted vegetables in this one makes it truly awesome on tacos, wings, and loads of other stuff!

Ant Bite - This is a heavyweight in the hot sauce world, so unless you like truly HOT stuff, stick to Light My Fire or go get something off the shelf, but if you are adventurous and like spicy stuff, give it a try! There is a lot of spice, but a lot of sweet too, thanks to fresh Red Delicious Apples. This sauce goes with a lot if you like it HOT. Try on Asian foods, salads, meat, and even eggs - you might be surprised by how good REALLY HOT can be!
Our Commitment To YOU

We are big believers in the idea that if you are going to do something, do it well - don’t skimp on quality.  Being good and kind to your customers has a way of coming back to you.  Hard work is said to be its own reward, but people who work hard tend to succeed.  And lastly, offer people a superior product for a fair price, and it will sell itself.  I am extremely proud of what I make, and I sign my name and put my phone number on every bottle that goes out my door. My sauces are really, really good, I sell them at a fair price, and I appreciate all my customers.  If that weren’t enough, I seriously do love what I do, and if that doesn’t count as success, I don’t know what does.
<h3><strong>Risks &amp

The COVID-19 virus has made a dramatic impact on our way of life and we have all had to adjust what we do and how we do it.  We understand that many of you may be dealing with financial hardships and may not be able to contribute, but we also know that many of you are now cooking at home more than ever before and are in search of something new to season and cook with. Now is the perfect time for you to experiment in the kitchen and for us to ramp up our production. Any challenges that come my way, I am personally dedicated to overcome them to 100% complete satisfaction.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute at this time, please consider sharing our campaign with your friends on Instagram and Facebook! Go to https://www.sonofajohn.com/ and sign up on our (e)mailing list
","SON OF A JOHN…YOUR NEW GO TO HOT SAUCE!

I also started growing a garden in the back yard - because homegrown vegetables are undisputedly the best!  With dreams of bountiful harvests, I planted my garden…and along with the tomatoes, carrots, and everything else, I planted WAY too many peppers. My veggies needed to drink and I gave them rainwater. They needed to eat too, and I became a worm farmer so they had good organic fertilizer. They thrived and produced – a LOT.  What to do with all those peppers? HOT SAUCE!!! I went into the kitchen and developed my first hot sauce recipe, Light My Fire…and it was good! Very good! Thus, Son Of A John was born – the best tasting (HOT) hot sauces in the South!

Being a good cook and liking to share, I began giving bottles to friends and family.  I got rave reviews from everyone on my first sauce and went back to the kitchen to create the next two even hotter sauces, Smokin’ Ghost and Ant Bite – both of which turned out just as tasty as the first…full of flavor and just as fantastic, if not BETTER!

People were trying to give me money for bottles to take to their friends and family, and more than one person told me I should start selling them because they really are THAT good! At this stage, I realize I have a knack for what I am doing. I have sold individual bottles and 3 bottle sets, which are a big time hit!  Everyone loves them!  Now, people are buying cases instead of bottles.  There is hot sauce everywhere!!  To keep up with the demand, it is time to get some help and work with a co-packer because Son Of A John has now outgrown my kitchen.
What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $15,000 to cover the costs of product analysis in a lab, product development costs, the printed labels with nutritional content and UPC and QR codes, and the first official run for each flavor totaling 150 gallons. I am set up to accommodate on-line sales and have ties to restaurants, bars, distributors and grocery stores to get these sauces on your table (and they are asking!!). I truly appreciate everyone who helps me kick this project up to the next level.

In exchange for your generous contributions to keep up with demand, we have some great perk packages where you can pre-order your choice of sauces in 1, 2, 3, or 12 quantities with no added shipping cost!! We are also working on getting stickers, t-shirts and some other cool stuff that we will add on as they become available.

Light My Fire- Made with habañero peppers and a unique blend of spices, this sauce is hot, sweet and smoky. Perfect for wings, pork, and just about any meat where you want to kick things up a notch! Goes great on a ton of other stuff too, so use your imaginations and your taste buds!

Smokin' Ghost - NOT for lightweights when it comes to hot sauces! This perfect blend of habañero and ghost peppers is rich and smooth with a big bite! The roasted vegetables in this one makes it truly awesome on tacos, wings, and loads of other stuff!

Ant Bite - This is a heavyweight in the hot sauce world, so unless you like truly HOT stuff, stick to Light My Fire or go get something off the shelf, but if you are adventurous and like spicy stuff, give it a try! There is a lot of spice, but a lot of sweet too, thanks to fresh Red Delicious Apples. This sauce goes with a lot if you like it HOT. Try on Asian foods, salads, meat, and even eggs - you might be surprised by how good REALLY HOT can be!
Our Commitment To YOU

We are big believers in the idea that if you are going to do something, do it well - don’t skimp on quality.  Being good and kind to your customers has a way of coming back to you.  Hard work is said to be its own reward, but people who work hard tend to succeed.  And lastly, offer people a superior product for a fair price, and it will sell itself.  I am extremely proud of what I make, and I sign my name and put my phone number on every bottle that goes out my door. My sauces are really, really good, I sell them at a fair price, and I appreciate all my customers.  If that weren’t enough, I seriously do love what I do, and if that doesn’t count as success, I don’t know what does.
Risks & Challenges

The COVID-19 virus has made a dramatic impact on our way of life and we have all had to adjust what we do and how we do it.  We understand that many of you may be dealing with financial hardships and may not be able to contribute, but we also know that many of you are now cooking at home more than ever before and are in search of something new to season and cook with. Now is the perfect time for you to experiment in the kitchen and for us to ramp up our production. Any challenges that come my way, I am personally dedicated to overcome them to 100% complete satisfaction.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, please consider sharing our campaign with your friends on Instagram and Facebook! Go to https://www.sonofajohn.com/ and sign up on our (e)mailing list",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Tallassee, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/son-of-a-john-no-preservatives-tasty-hot-sauces/pica

Welcome to the next evolution in home juicing. The ""I M Possible"" or ""Impossible"". We all lead and live busy lives, always on the go, and often we do not have the time to take care of ourselves. We have all been here before, we wake up and are getting ready for work, and we go to the kitchen and start preparing our vegetables and fruits to make our favorite juice blend. We have just created a delicious and healthy beverage full of vitamins and nutrients that we need to kick-start our day. In the wake of creating our beverage, we have created an incredible mess and we are now almost running late for work. Traditional juicers have many moving parts that need to be cleaned and stored away properly which is very time-consuming. The I M Possible now eliminates the incredible hassle of a lengthily time-consuming cleanup process and lets you get on with your day. 4 years and over 150 prototypes later we have created the absolutely perfect juicer. What makes our juicer superior to every single juicer on the market today? It is self-cleaning! Our I M Possible juicer will save you valuable time every morning, afternoon, and evening. The I M Possible Juicer will be the new standard in home and retail juicing and we are inviting you along for the journey.

How can you get one of our I M Possible Juicers in your home? Simply pledge $95 and we will ship one to you before Dec/2018, and don't worry, we will ship worldwide! This will make a perfect juicing companion for yourself or an amazing gift for a loved one who is health conscious or even tired of cleaning up the incredible mess left behind by traditional juicers. Please if you can make a pledge today we can get our product to market and make a real difference in the lives of many by offering healthy choices and by saving a lot of time each day to do more important things. If you cannot pledge please share this campaign with your friends and family within your social circles, perhaps someone you know is willing to pledge or interested in purchasing the I M Possible Juicer.

Thank you!

About Sam and the Asobu Partnership
column3: >

column1:
Sam Schubert - Creator of Asobu® PourOver

I teamed up with Asobu® for a second time around to help produce the best Insulated PourOver Coffee Maker possible. Our goal was to create a high quality Pour Over Coffee Maker that kept the coffee hot and fresh for the entire day. 

Asobu® is an established drink ware company with 20+ years of manufacturing expereince in insulated coffee products made from stainless steel. They're leaders of the industry with the most recent success of our past Kickstarter partnership, The Asobu® Coldbrew, which was selected as Oprah's Favorite Things for the holiday season of 2017! 

The combination of Asobu®'s manufacturing experience and relationships in China makes it a guarantee that the PourOvers will reach it's destination on time and in great condition.  

I invite you to be an extended part of our team and back this project so I can cover the final production and shipping costs!

>I will be releasing two lines of Dominantly Delicious Chocolates. The first will be recreations of My body. These aren't items that have been sculpted to resemble Me, but rather they are exact replicas. The chocolates are made from moulds taken directly from My body by a skilled molding professional. I am starting with: The Toe Bar, Peep Toe Platform Shoes, and a recreation of My lips. This is just the tip of the iceberg. More chocolates cast from various parts of My body will be released on an ongoing basis. 


The second line of chocolates will be focused on My favourite toys and tools, the first of which will be a chocolate recreation of a real pair of Handcuffs. Like the body parts, these will be created from molds of actual items, not tiny sculpted replicas of them.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: justify

If I reach $30,000 I will add a chocolate blindfold to the selection of chocolates. Everyone who pledged $50 or more will receive one (or more depending on their chosen perk) free with their order. Everyone who pledged less than $50 will be able to purchase them at a reduced price.
If I reach $40,000 I will add a chocolate paddle to the selection of chocolates with the same stipulations as the chocolate blindfold.

If I reach $50,000 I will add a chocolate whip to the selection of chocolates. This will be a larger item. Everyone who pledged $75 or more will receive one (or more depending on their chosen perk) for free. Anyone who pledged less will be able to purchase the whip at a reduced price.

If My pledges exceed $75,000 I will follow through with the stretch goal that was (not-so) subtly hinted at in My video. I will undergo breast augmentation. Afterwards, I will have a 3D scan taken of My new 'assets'. From this scan I'll have a unique and very limited-run chocolate created. Everyone who pledged $200 or more will receive one (or more, depending on the perk chosen) for free. Everyone who pledged will be able to purchase My chocolate 'assets'. This item will never  be available in any store or on any website. Due to the technical nature and recovery time involved with this particular stretch goal, the fulfillment date will be later than the other perks. I will keep you updated.
<div>
<div>

If I exceed $100,000, I will be hosting a  launch party. Everyone who pledges will receive a free invite. Varying levels of VIP status will be distributed based on pledges. If you are unable to make it, the party will be live-streamed for you, and I will have a camera following Me everywhere. If you are a VIP pledger and are unable to make it, you'll receive some live VIP treatment during the party. There will be a number of prizes being drawn during the course of the party, and only those in attendance (live or virtual) will be able to claim them. These prizes will range from some of My personal items to one on one time with Me.
The Impact

column2:

If you have any questions that you would like answered, feel free to ask them publicly or privately.

You have My gratitude.

column1: ","Sex and Chocolate. Few things go together better. Considering My tastes and proclivities since youth, it's fitting that I'm not starting a 'vanilla' candy company. I am a Professional and Lifestyle Dominatrix, and I live and work in Toronto, Canada. In Addition to being a Domme, I am also quite active writing, podcasting, life coaching, mentoring, volunteering, & acting as an advocate for mental health. Who wants these chocolates? Just about anyone. Do you need a subtle hint to give your lover in an attempt to spice things up in the bedroom? Offering them a pair of chocolate handcuffs would be a delicious way to get the message across. Do you want to tell your lover that you fantasize about licking her toes? Purchase some chocolate toes and show her how you'd do it. Whether you are looking to make things more interesting or you are a fetishist looking for new forms of expression, there's a tasty solution here for you. I was disappointed at the lack of kinky chocolates available in local sex stores. After doing some research and realizing that there really isn't much out there, I decided to do something about it. I wanted to give people more than a chocolate that vaguely resembled a part of the anatomy or favourite toy, I wanted to give people an experience in chocolate. Regardless of your particular kink or fetish, there will certainly be something that titillates you. I will be releasing two lines of Dominantly Delicious Chocolates. The first will be recreations of My body. These aren't items that have been sculpted to resemble Me, but rather they are exact replicas. The chocolates are made from moulds taken directly from My body by a skilled molding professional. I am starting with: The Toe Bar, Peep Toe Platform Shoes, and a recreation of My lips. This is just the tip of the iceberg. More chocolates cast from various parts of My body will be released on an ongoing basis. The second line of chocolates will be focused on My favourite toys and tools, the first of which will be a chocolate recreation of a real pair of Handcuffs. Like the body parts, these will be created from molds of actual items, not tiny sculpted replicas of them.

Your contributions are the final piece in this nearly-assembled puzzle. Having the initial moulds of My body & toys made has been the first step. The next step is to have production moulds & packaging created. Until this venture, I never appreciated how much money is spent on properly packaging a consumer item. Anything I raise above and beyond the immediate costs of paying for the moulds & packaging (when added to My own savings) will be used to secure a 3D scanner & printer, as well as other stretch goals.
What I Need & What You Get
A few initial points:
1. You can contribute to this campaign anonymously - simply check the box that reads ""don't display my name on the campaign page"" when you make payment.
2. Any items sent to you will be shipped discreetly.

3. You can select your level of anonymity when being mentioned on My website, newsletter, blog etc. based on the various perks. Simply let Me know how you would like be listed when I express My appreciation (eg. John Smith, J. Smith, J.S., slave john, etc.)

Any money raised, whether I reach My goal or not, will first go towards paying for production moulds & clamshell packaging. Remaining funds will be used to purchase a 3D scanner followed by a 3D printer. As stretch goals are reached, the money will be spent to facilitate the creation of the stretch goal items. If any money is left over it will be used to assist in securing a distribution centre that will double as My event venue.

The perks have been designed to fill two main categories. The first is for people who wish to contribute and receive some thank-you items in the mail in the form of chocolates and photographs. The second category of perks is for those of you who still want the physical items, but also wish to spend some one on one time with Me.
Stretch Goals

If I reach $30,000 I will add a chocolate blindfold to the selection of chocolates. Everyone who pledged $50 or more will receive one (or more depending on their chosen perk) free with their order. Everyone who pledged less than $50 will be able to purchase them at a reduced price.
If I reach $40,000 I will add a chocolate paddle to the selection of chocolates with the same stipulations as the chocolate blindfold.

If I reach $50,000 I will add a chocolate whip to the selection of chocolates. This will be a larger item. Everyone who pledged $75 or more will receive one (or more depending on their chosen perk) for free. Anyone who pledged less will be able to purchase the whip at a reduced price.

If My pledges exceed $75,000 I will follow through with the stretch goal that was (not-so) subtly hinted at in My video. I will undergo breast augmentation. Afterwards, I will have a 3D scan taken of My new 'assets'. From this scan I'll have a unique and very limited-run chocolate created. Everyone who pledged $200 or more will receive one (or more, depending on the perk chosen) for free. Everyone who pledged will be able to purchase My chocolate 'assets'. This item will never  be available in any store or on any website. Due to the technical nature and recovery time involved with this particular stretch goal, the fulfillment date will be later than the other perks. I will keep you updated.

If I exceed $100,000, I will be hosting a  launch party. Everyone who pledges will receive a free invite. Varying levels of VIP status will be distributed based on pledges. If you are unable to make it, the party will be live-streamed for you, and I will have a camera following Me everywhere. If you are a VIP pledger and are unable to make it, you'll receive some live VIP treatment during the party. There will be a number of prizes being drawn during the course of the party, and only those in attendance (live or virtual) will be able to claim them. These prizes will range from some of My personal items to one on one time with Me.
The Impact

Asking for help isn't something that I do easily. This project is extremely important to Me. I'm a diverse woman, both intellectually and financially, and this new venture excites Me, however it is something that I am unable to launch without assistance.If you have any questions that you would like answered, feel free to ask them publicly or privately.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, it doesn't mean that you are unable to help Me! Do what you can to spread the word about this campaign: share it on Facebook & Twitter, tell everyone you know about it, paint the link to this site on the side of your car, whatever it takes! Don't forget to make use of the Indiegogo Share Tools. You have My gratitude.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
THE STORY
Bowls are a great way to store things and easy to manage, just like Tupperware, but if we stored everything in our fridge in containers, we’d never have any space in there!

So of course, the solution is simple – Ziploc and other kinds of storage bags, but once it’s time to get out the soup, leftovers, or freezer meals that you’ve put in there, they’re such a hassle to work with. They can’t stand upright, they fall over when you try to put them in pots and pans, and then you’re left with more of your food on the kitchen floor and the counter than on your plate.
But what if there was a device that gave you an easy way to manage your bags in the kitchen, and also doubled as a drying rack for your storage bags?
That’s where our Handy Helpers come in.
THE PROJECT

Having 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands-Free Baggy Holders is just like having an extra set of hands in the kitchen. With easy to use clips and slid base to hold your bags in place, handle up to a gallon of liquid and other food items with no spills, and no worry.
Use them to hold your bags in place whether you’re storing food, need to have your bag open while you’re cooking and making meals, or just to dry out your storage bags between use.
WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

The 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands Free Baggy Holder Team is looking to raise enough funding for our very first production run. We’ve already tested and had great success with the prototype, so now it’s time to get manufacturing so we can bring them right to you!

But we don’t want your support in exchange for nothing! Therefore, we invite you to check out our reward tiers, where you have the chance to secure your very own set of 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands Free Baggy Holders, starting with the 2-pack reward for the low pledge of just $15. Get as much as you’d like (trust me, we’re not complaining), and hey, why not make a couple donations on behalf of your friends who love cooking?
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can’t donate at this time? That doesn’t mean you can’t help. Share our campaign on your social media pages like Twitter or Facebook, on your favourite cooking blogs, or even make a post about it in your cooking groups!

Have a friend or family member that loves to make dishes and experiment in the kitchen? Why not send the link along to them? The 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands Free Baggy Holder would even make a great gift, so why not link to the campaign with a nice hint that you’d like one just for yourself?
Thanks so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. If you have any questions, please send them along, and we’ll be sure to answer them as soon as we can.
Happy bagging!

That’s where our Handy Helpers come in.

Having 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands-Free Baggy Holders is just like having an extra set of hands in the kitchen. With easy to use clips and slid base to hold your bags in place, handle up to a gallon of liquid and other food items with no spills, and no worry.
Use them to hold your bags in place whether you’re storing food, need to have your bag open while you’re cooking and making meals, or just to dry out your storage bags between use.
WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

The 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands Free Baggy Holder Team is looking to raise enough funding for our very first production run. We’ve already tested and had great success with the prototype, so now it’s time to get manufacturing so we can bring them right to you!

But we don’t want your support in exchange for nothing! Therefore, we invite you to check out our reward tiers, where you have the chance to secure your very own set of 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands Free Baggy Holders, starting with the 2-pack reward for the low pledge of just $15. Get as much as you’d like (trust me, we’re not complaining), and hey, why not make a couple donations on behalf of your friends who love cooking?
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can’t donate at this time? That doesn’t mean you can’t help. Share our campaign on your social media pages like Twitter or Facebook, on your favourite cooking blogs, or even make a post about it in your cooking groups!

Have a friend or family member that loves to make dishes and experiment in the kitchen? Why not send the link along to them? The 20 Dishes Handy Helper Hands Free Baggy Holder would even make a great gift, so why not link to the campaign with a nice hint that you’d like one just for yourself?
Thanks so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. If you have any questions, please send them along, and we’ll be sure to answer them as soon as we can.
Happy bagging!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Lakewood, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/handy-helper-hands-free-baggy-holders/pica

column2:
>Let’s make local accessible - together 

Picture this: You get home from a long day of work and your groceries are waiting for you on your doorstep.  Or maybe you haven't left the house and you're still in your pajamas and a box of fresh, local food, customized to your liking, is delivered right to your doorstep.  

Mark your calendars for early October because this is going to become a reality!  We will be launching the first full online farmers’ market in Atlantic Canada.  You'll be able to do all of your grocery shopping in one place and feel good knowing your purchases make a difference in your community! 

To make this dream a reality, we need your support.
column3:
>Why the change? 

We had such a great response to our mobile market and food boxes - that we started thinking about how we could better serve you while making it even easier to buy local products.  We are really excited as this will further our vision of increasing access to healthy food for everyone in our community.

To kick start our new service, we are launching a campaign.  If you’re interested in having your local food and products delivered to your front door, please sign up as a member. As one of the first people to sign up, you will receive mega-perks (see below)! Our goal is to sign up 300 members by our launch date!
column4:
>Local Tastes Better When Being a Member

Here’s Why:

column1: • Free home deliveries.
• Discounts! Who doesn’t love a deal? We will have special discounts exclusive to our members.
• Weekly local recipes prepared by some of the best chefs in Moncton. “Cauliflower ‘steak”, anyone?
• There is no time like the present - the special membership prices in this campaign will only be offered until we reach our goal.

They are 2 ways to order on the online store, using a basic account or with the Local Ambassador membership.

If you would like to register for a free account click here.

Tell me more. Tell me more!
column2:
>YOU Chose the Contents of Your Box!

Our online store will allow us to deliver you the freshest products AND let you choose the products YOU WANT to have delivered to your home.
column3:
>FRESHEST Products in Town

Each week, there will be new products to discover. You can choose to be notified with the updates and go in and place your order. We will process all of the orders on Wednesday each week and then get to work calling farmers’ and local producers to fulfill your requests. Saturday morning food will be harvested from fields across the province, and two days later it will be on your front step waiting to be turned into something delicious!
column4:
>Since the beginning…

The Farmers’ Truck was created by two entrepreneurs Frederic Laforge and Mathieu Reyjal. Fred grew up on a farm and always appreciated local food, but could never align his schedule to get to the market during opening hours. Mathieu, was just starting his career in farming and wanted to find new markets to sell his products. The two got together one evening over a beer and the mobile farmers’ market, known as The Farmers’ Truck, was born.
column5:
>Serving you and local producers has been our mission

Since our proof of concept in 2015, we have served over 10,000 customers with our mobile farmers’ market, delivered over 1,000 local food boxes, and created lasting partnerships around the community through our employee wellness programs and our Farmers’ Truck Bucks program.
column6:
>Local Action = Local Impact

We believe everyone should get to take part in the harvest and do not want the harvest to end. By helping our cause, you get to make a vote for local. Our online store will be the one stop shop for everything New Brunswick. From vegetables, to meat, to coffee, to soap - if we grow it, bake it, or make it in our province, we will have it! 

Help us pave the way to a more connected local food system. We want to thank all of our customers and supporters for embarking on this new journey with us!

<h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center
column2: >""Delicious, raw and ethical.  Benefitting thousands of lives.  So proud of our Mama Buci honey.""

column7: '> My name is Martin Zuch, founder of Mama Buci, a social enterprise. I want to share with you our exciting journey of how we have improved the quality of life of over 10,000 families by building over 150 bee hives a day, training beekeepers and harvesting tastebud tantalising ethical, cold pressed HONEY.

column1: Before Mama Buci I was a Hedge Fund Manager but one day while I was enjoying the trappings of my success I realised that there had to be more to life than just making money.  I wanted to do more to help others in a philanthropic way and decided to focus my newfound commitment on the poorest communities in Africa . So I jacked in the day job and started my search for the best way to do this.

As with anything in life I tried and failed but I got back on my horse as I was determined not to give up on my mission.  It was essential to continue sustaining the school we had built as part the initial projects I had already started in the community.

It was then that my dear friend, John Enright, mentioned the potential of commercial bee keeping.  I threw myself at this new idea and created Mama Buci.  After a lot of time and investment we have finally been able to have a positive impact, helping over 10,000 families in Zambia!  But there is more to be done which is why I am here asking for your help!

Mama Buci has built over 105,000 beehives which provide a secure income for over 10,000 families.  But our ambition is much bigger than this.  By 2022 we want to have over 500,000 hives across the Zambian forest.  This would provide secure income for 50,000 families and provide education for over 100,000 children!  In fact, every single jar of delicious Mama Buci honey sold provides education and a meal for a child.
I invite you to join me on the Mama Buci journey...and to play a part in the effort that will make a difference to the lives of thousands of people across Zambia!
<h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center

Mama Buci honey is lovingly hand-harvested by over 10,000 trusted families in the virgin Miombo forests of Central Zambia. The amber, polyfloral, raw honey is produced from hive to bottle with no additives, preservatives, economic adulterants or other nasties.

We can’t take all the credit for its delicious taste though, as it’s the millions of bees that do most of the hard work. The African bees take their nectar and pollen from a rich variety of wildflowers in the Miombo forest that change from season to season. This is why we have two different types of honey, our summer and winter harvest.
The Summer Harvest has a light amber, floral taste with tantalising hints of aniseed and fennel. It’s earthy flavours make it a great accompaniment to cheese or other savoury foods.

The Winter Harvest has a rich, sweet, dark amber flavour with comforting hints of black treacle (molasses). It tastes scrumptious spread over toast, drizzled over yogurt or stirred in your favourite brew.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

Beekeeping has been a popular income-generating activity in Zambia for centuries. However, most of the honey produced is kept in traditional bark hives, which involves a harvesting process that strips the bark from the tree ultimately leading to its death. This not only has a negative impact on the environment but also to the beekeepers income as the bees need to feed off the trees to produce honey.

This all changed however with the introduction of the top bar beehive which is where our delicious honey is created.  The top bar hive yields twice the amount of honey than the traditional bark hive and causes absolutely no damage to the trees and surrounding forest.

After 2 years of struggling with technical problems involved with the beehives themselves my partner came up with the new design of the tree top bar hive. To our delight, the bees started to flourish, producing over 12kg of honey on average per hive in a structure that, if maintained properly, could last a lifetime. That’s when we knew we had found something with the potential to really make a difference.

Now we are building over 150 beehives a day, 5 days a week, in our local Zambian workshop. We have provided over 105,000 beehives which will produce over 400 tonnes of delicious raw honey this year alone.
<h3 style=""text-align: center

Our focus starts with educating the beekeepers and families on how to work with their land to help maintain a healthy eco-system.  Mama Buci supports over 10,000 families in Zambia by providing them with beehives and beekeeper training needed to produce delicious raw honey that has a positive impact on the environment. In order to rebuild and invigorate impoverished communities, education is key, and that’s what is at the heart of the Mama Buci story.  Over the years we have watched communities, individuals and forests flourish.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center

In 2006 we set up the Luyando school in Kamafwesa which is now enjoyed by over 420 children and provides work for 11 local teachers. The school has made such a difference to the prospects of this community and our goal is to continue to support more schools as Mama Buci grows. As part of our vision to support education, we also set up the charity Give Hope International which manages and expands Mama Buci's educational aspirations which it is now doing in Zambia, Malawi and Ethiopa.

column2: >All Indiegogo supporters will be provided with an E-newsletter update.  Supporters will be listed on our website (unless otherwise stated) as 'Friends of Mama Buci' for a minimum of 1 year.  Those who have taken a Teacher or School Support package will be recognised on Give Hope International's website.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center

Through the help of dear friends, honey lovers worldwide and our passionate ambassadors, Charlie Mackesy and Bear Grylls, in addition to HRH Duke of York, we are spreading the message of our venture far and wide so we can continue to help more families, build more schools, and provide you all with a delicious, healthy and soulful alternative to mainstream honey products. By purchasing a pot of our honey you are becoming part of the growing Mama Buci story and directly affecting change in communities that really need our help.
By achieving our Indiegogo goal we will be able to:
<ul>
• With your help we will be able to develop the marketing and sales resources to enter the retail environment and get Mama Buci into a shop near you
• Train more beekeepers, thereby helping more families and communities out of poverty
• Provide more educational resources and free school places
<h3 style=""text-align: center
<strong>Make a difference today
column2: invest in a Perk, enjoy our honey and make the Mama Buci honey available near you!

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center
Tell all your friends about us!  Click on the Facebook icon at the top of this page and share with everyone and join the Mama Buci dream!

column2: >Please email us directly at the contact details below!

column1:
What does Mama Buci mean?
Mother Honey in Bemba, the local language

Where does Mama Buci honey come from?
Our honey is from the virgin Miombo forests in Zambia

How much money does Mama Buci give to the Luyando school?
For every jar sold Mama Buci donates a minimum of 50p which is the equivalent to a meal a day for children attending.

Does Mama Buci run the school?
No, the school is run by the teachers, but was founded by Mama Buci CEO Martin Zuch. The school is funded by Good Hope International, a registered charity.

How many children attend the school?
At the moment, there are 420 children attending, across all age groups from different villages. As incomes improve, families will be able to afford to send their children to school as education in Zambia is not free.  The school we support is for those who are unable to afford to educate their children.

Why is the Winter honey so dark and the Summer so light?
The colour of the honey is determined by the nectar that is collected from the local flora and what is in flower when. This affects the colour and honey flavour. As have 2 harvests this reflected in the colour and flavour variations of the 2 seasons

How have lives been transformed through the Mama Buci beekeeping program?
Beekeeping can take people out of poverty and because we pay a fair price for the honey harvested there is positive impact on not just the beekeepers’ families but also within the village. For example, where they were living in poor accommodation, they are now able to live in brick houses with steel roofs protecting them from the elements.  Please visit our site to learn more:  http://mamabuci.com/meetthebeekeepers/

Can I cook with Mama Buci Honey?
Yes, you can use Mama Buci honey in your recipes where honey is an ingredient or as a sugar substitute.

When will my Christmas Gift PERK be despatched?
We aim to despatch your perk within 14 days of you signing up, so that it arrives to you in plenty of time for gifting. We will contact you to tell you its on its way.

Will my Perk be tracked?
Yes where possible your parcel will be tracked and you will be provided with tracking information at the time of despatch.

How long will it take for my Perk to arrive?
Depending on your Perk and country, it should arrive within 5-7 days of despatch.

How many beekeepers are producing honey for Mama Buci?
Our beekeeper numbers are increasing all the time but there are currently 11,000 Beekeepers with whom we are working.

Do the beekeepers have to pay for the hives that you supply?
No, we provide all the beekeepers with between and 5 and 10 hives free, as well as protective clothing.

How do the beekeepers get paid?
Each beekeeper is paid cash on the day of honey harvesting, by weight.

How does Mama Buci choose the beekeepers?
We work closely with the village elders in the first instance and either the Elder, the equivalent of a Chief/Leader, nominates an individual(s) or the village will nominate the person(s) that they think should be the beekeeper.

Are there any women beekeepers?
Yes, beekeeping is not a single gender activity. There are women supporting their families through beekeeping with Mama Buci. You can read our beekeeper stories on our website http://mamabuci.com/meetthebeekeepers/

How many hives do you have in the forest?
At the moment, we have over 105,000 hives in the Miombo forest.

How many beekeepers and hives will you have in 5 years time?
We hope to be working with and helping 50,000 beekeepers, by 2022 which would mean that there would be 500,000 hives in the forest.  If Mama Buci can reach this target, we will be making it possible for 100,000 children to attend school on a daily basis (based on the average of 2 children per family attending).

Why does Mama Buci not use Bark Hives?
We use top bar hives which are made from timber offcuts and manufacturing timber waste. This enables us to help preserve the forest and not damage the trees on which the wildlife, climate and villages depend upon for food &
column2: shelter.  Unfortunately, bark hives destroy the trees and can leave the honey tainted.

column1:
Who makes the hives?
Local carpenters are employed to build the hives that we give to beekeepers

Do the children have to wear a uniform?
It is preferable for the children to wear a uniform, which we provide, as clothing can be expensive and is often hand me down so it helps them to feel that they belong

What language are the children taught in?
English is deemed the national language, so we teach in English and the local language of Bemba.

How many teachers are there at the school?
We currently have 12 teachers.

What subjects are taught at school?
English, Maths, Geography, Reading &

Will Mama Buci help support more schools?
As part of our objectives we hope to be able contribute funds to Good Hope International so that they may build more schools within Zambia and bordering countries, to secure more opportunities in their future.

When the honey is harvested are the bees killed?
No, we train our beekeepers on the importance of leaving the brood (Queen, Worker bees, Drones, eggs and larvae in tact) We only take the surplus honey and leave the bees within the hive.

Will the honey crystallise and if it does what should I do?
All raw honey will crystallise over time. The crystallisation process is natural and does not mean that it is spoiled. Pure, raw and unheated honey has a natural tendency to crystallize over time with no effect on the honey other than colour and texture. If your honey should crystallise then stand the jar in warm water, in the airing cupboard or somewhere warm with an indirect heat and it will slowly return to a liquid. Don’t keep you honey in the fridge as this will accelerate the crystallisation process.

What is cold pressed filtered honey?
The honey combe is pressed and then naturally filtered through sieves to separate the wax, any pollen or hive debris from the honey which runs through the sieve.

Is the honey Organic?
Mama Buci honey is harvested from Virgin forests which has no pesticide use within it or on the land neighbouring the forest. Our honey has been certified organic in Zambia, it does not hold a Soil Association organic certificate at this time.

Has Mama Buci honey won any awards?
Yes in 2014 it won a Great Taste Award. Great Taste, organised by the Guild of Fine Food, is the acknowledged benchmark for fine food and drink. It has been described as the ‘Oscars’ of the food world and the ‘epicurean equivalent of the Booker prize’.
<h3 style=""text-align: center
","""Delicious, raw and ethical.  Benefitting thousands of lives.  So proud of our Mama Buci honey.""
Bear Grylls

Hello! My name is Martin Zuch, founder of Mama Buci, a social enterprise. I want to share with you our exciting journey of how we have improved the quality of life of over 10,000 families by building over 150 bee hives a day, training beekeepers and harvesting tastebud tantalising ethical, cold pressed HONEY.

Before Mama Buci I was a Hedge Fund Manager but one day while I was enjoying the trappings of my success I realised that there had to be more to life than just making money.  I wanted to do more to help others in a philanthropic way and decided to focus my newfound commitment on the poorest communities in Africa . So I jacked in the day job and started my search for the best way to do this.

As with anything in life I tried and failed but I got back on my horse as I was determined not to give up on my mission.  It was essential to continue sustaining the school we had built as part the initial projects I had already started in the community.

It was then that my dear friend, John Enright, mentioned the potential of commercial bee keeping.  I threw myself at this new idea and created Mama Buci.  After a lot of time and investment we have finally been able to have a positive impact, helping over 10,000 families in Zambia!  But there is more to be done which is why I am here asking for your help!

Mama Buci has built over 105,000 beehives which provide a secure income for over 10,000 families.  But our ambition is much bigger than this.  By 2022 we want to have over 500,000 hives across the Zambian forest.  This would provide secure income for 50,000 families and provide education for over 100,000 children!  In fact, every single jar of delicious Mama Buci honey sold provides education and a meal for a child.
I invite you to join me on the Mama Buci journey...and to play a part in the effort that will make a difference to the lives of thousands of people across Zambia!

Mama Buci honey is lovingly hand-harvested by over 10,000 trusted families in the virgin Miombo forests of Central Zambia. The amber, polyfloral, raw honey is produced from hive to bottle with no additives, preservatives, economic adulterants or other nasties.

We can’t take all the credit for its delicious taste though, as it’s the millions of bees that do most of the hard work. The African bees take their nectar and pollen from a rich variety of wildflowers in the Miombo forest that change from season to season. This is why we have two different types of honey, our summer and winter harvest.
The Summer Harvest has a light amber, floral taste with tantalising hints of aniseed and fennel. It’s earthy flavours make it a great accompaniment to cheese or other savoury foods.

The Winter Harvest has a rich, sweet, dark amber flavour with comforting hints of black treacle (molasses). It tastes scrumptious spread over toast, drizzled over yogurt or stirred in your favourite brew.

Beekeeping has been a popular income-generating activity in Zambia for centuries. However, most of the honey produced is kept in traditional bark hives, which involves a harvesting process that strips the bark from the tree ultimately leading to its death. This not only has a negative impact on the environment but also to the beekeepers income as the bees need to feed off the trees to produce honey.

This all changed however with the introduction of the top bar beehive which is where our delicious honey is created.  The top bar hive yields twice the amount of honey than the traditional bark hive and causes absolutely no damage to the trees and surrounding forest.

After 2 years of struggling with technical problems involved with the beehives themselves my partner came up with the new design of the tree top bar hive. To our delight, the bees started to flourish, producing over 12kg of honey on average per hive in a structure that, if maintained properly, could last a lifetime. That’s when we knew we had found something with the potential to really make a difference.

Now we are building over 150 beehives a day, 5 days a week, in our local Zambian workshop. We have provided over 105,000 beehives which will produce over 400 tonnes of delicious raw honey this year alone.

Our focus starts with educating the beekeepers and families on how to work with their land to help maintain a healthy eco-system.  Mama Buci supports over 10,000 families in Zambia by providing them with beehives and beekeeper training needed to produce delicious raw honey that has a positive impact on the environment. In order to rebuild and invigorate impoverished communities, education is key, and that’s what is at the heart of the Mama Buci story.  Over the years we have watched communities, individuals and forests flourish.

In 2006 we set up the Luyando school in Kamafwesa which is now enjoyed by over 420 children and provides work for 11 local teachers. The school has made such a difference to the prospects of this community and our goal is to continue to support more schools as Mama Buci grows. As part of our vision to support education, we also set up the charity Give Hope International which manages and expands Mama Buci's educational aspirations which it is now doing in Zambia, Malawi and Ethiopa.

All Indiegogo supporters will be provided with an E-newsletter update.  Supporters will be listed on our website (unless otherwise stated) as 'Friends of Mama Buci' for a minimum of 1 year.  Those who have taken a Teacher or School Support package will be recognised on Give Hope International's website.

Through the help of dear friends, honey lovers worldwide and our passionate ambassadors, Charlie Mackesy and Bear Grylls, in addition to HRH Duke of York, we are spreading the message of our venture far and wide so we can continue to help more families, build more schools, and provide you all with a delicious, healthy and soulful alternative to mainstream honey products. By purchasing a pot of our honey you are becoming part of the growing Mama Buci story and directly affecting change in communities that really need our help.
By achieving our Indiegogo goal we will be able to:
With your help we will be able to develop the marketing and sales resources to enter the retail environment and get Mama Buci into a shop near you
Train more beekeepers, thereby helping more families and communities out of poverty
Provide more educational resources and free school places
Make a difference today

When will my Christmas Gift PERK be despatched?We aim to despatch your perk within 14 days of you signing up, so that it arrives to you in plenty of time for gifting. We will contact you to tell you its on its way.
Will my Perk be tracked?Yes where possible your parcel will be tracked and you will be provided with tracking information at the time of despatch.
How long will it take for my Perk to arrive?Depending on your Perk and country, it should arrive within 5-7 days of despatch.
How many beekeepers are producing honey for Mama Buci?Our beekeeper numbers are increasing all the time but there are currently 11,000 Beekeepers with whom we are working.
Do the beekeepers have to pay for the hives that you supply?No, we provide all the beekeepers with between and 5 and 10 hives free, as well as protective clothing.
How do the beekeepers get paid?Each beekeeper is paid cash on the day of honey harvesting, by weight.

How does Mama Buci choose the beekeepers?We work closely with the village elders in the first instance and either the Elder, the equivalent of a Chief/Leader, nominates an individual(s) or the village will nominate the person(s) that they think should be the beekeeper.

Are there any women beekeepers?Yes, beekeeping is not a single gender activity. There are women supporting their families through beekeeping with Mama Buci. You can read our beekeeper stories on our website http://mamabuci.com/meetthebeekeepers/
How many hives do you have in the forest?At the moment, we have over 105,000 hives in the Miombo forest.

How many beekeepers and hives will you have in 5 years time?We hope to be working with and helping 50,000 beekeepers, by 2022 which would mean that there would be 500,000 hives in the forest.  If Mama Buci can reach this target, we will be making it possible for 100,000 children to attend school on a daily basis (based on the average of 2 children per family attending).

Why does Mama Buci not use Bark Hives?We use top bar hives which are made from timber offcuts and manufacturing timber waste. This enables us to help preserve the forest and not damage the trees on which the wildlife, climate and villages depend upon for food & shelter.  Unfortunately, bark hives destroy the trees and can leave the honey tainted.
Who makes the hives?Local carpenters are employed to build the hives that we give to beekeepers

Do the children have to wear a uniform?It is preferable for the children to wear a uniform, which we provide, as clothing can be expensive and is often hand me down so it helps them to feel that they belong
What language are the children taught in?English is deemed the national language, so we teach in English and the local language of Bemba.
How many teachers are there at the school?We currently have 12 teachers.
What subjects are taught at school?English, Maths, Geography, Reading & Writing,

Will Mama Buci help support more schools?As part of our objectives we hope to be able contribute funds to Good Hope International so that they may build more schools within Zambia and bordering countries, to secure more opportunities in their future.

When the honey is harvested are the bees killed?No, we train our beekeepers on the importance of leaving the brood (Queen, Worker bees, Drones, eggs and larvae in tact) We only take the surplus honey and leave the bees within the hive.

Will the honey crystallise and if it does what should I do?All raw honey will crystallise over time. The crystallisation process is natural and does not mean that it is spoiled. Pure, raw and unheated honey has a natural tendency to crystallize over time with no effect on the honey other than colour and texture. If your honey should crystallise then stand the jar in warm water, in the airing cupboard or somewhere warm with an indirect heat and it will slowly return to a liquid. Don’t keep you honey in the fridge as this will accelerate the crystallisation process.
What is cold pressed filtered honey?The honey combe is pressed and then naturally filtered through sieves to separate the wax, any pollen or hive debris from the honey which runs through the sieve.

Is the honey Organic?Mama Buci honey is harvested from Virgin forests which has no pesticide use within it or on the land neighbouring the forest. Our honey has been certified organic in Zambia, it does not hold a Soil Association organic certificate at this time.

Has Mama Buci honey won any awards?Yes in 2014 it won a Great Taste Award. Great Taste, organised by the Guild of Fine Food, is the acknowledged benchmark for fine food and drink. It has been described as the ‘Oscars’ of the food world and the ‘epicurean equivalent of the Booker prize’.",31.0,1,"1 Campaign
|","London, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/mama-buci-honey-that-makes-a-difference/pica

Learn more about the Artisan Collection:

Chef’s Collection was born to redefine what premium cutlery should be about. We have designed each collection to deliver the best in class experience to customers, by utilizing high-quality materials and meticulously handcrafting each knife to achieve the perfect balance of performance, precision, durability, and elegance.

After a successful launch on Indiegogo, we are bringing a second project to life, and introducing the Artisan Collection. A premium set of kitchen knives forged with 67 layers of premium VG10 Damascus steel, full tang design, and Rosewood handle.

The blades of this collection are incredibly sharp and resistant, with a core of high carbon steel and handcrafted finishing. The knives are designed with full-tang structure to deliver ultimate performance and lasting durability.

This collection is an expression of art that will excite cooking enthusiasts around the world. We are proud and passionate about the products we are developing and have no doubt that you will fall in love with them as well.
​Join us, and help bring Chef’s Collection to life.
Risks and challenges

This is our second project on Indiegogo. The first project was successfully funded and all rewards were shipped to backers in less than 30 days. The knives of this collection have already been designed, tested, and approved for production. The initial batch will ship the knives in March 2021, targeting the delivery for the last 2 weeks of the month.

English Follow
 

Intro

La route qui mène nos cafés d’exception de l’arbre à votre tasse est longue.

Chez Traffic, nous avons à cœur de traiter avec respect le sol qui lui donne vie, les agriculteurs qui veillent sur lui, les artisans qui le torréfient.

Et, afin que cette aventure épique ait aussi des retombées positives ici, nous offrons un petit déjeuner à un enfant dans le besoin pour chaque sac de café vendu.

Nous sommes des lève-tôt. Mais nous croyons qu’il n’est jamais trop tard pour bien faire, au coin de la rue, comme aux quatre coins de la terre.

Bienvenue dans le club.

-TCC
http://trafficcoffee.com

-----

Intro

The road that leads to our exceptional coffees - from the tree to your cup - is a long one.

At Traffic, we cherish the soil which gives life to our coffee, the farmers who look after it daily and the craftsmen who roast it perfectly.

To make sure this epic adventure echoes positively in our community, for every bag we sell, we provide a breakfast to a child in need.

We are morning people. But we believe it’s never too late to create change, may it be right down the road or everywhere else on Mother Earth.

Welcome to the Club.

-TCC
http://trafficcoffee.com/en

 

Les besoins

Nous avons besoin de 25 000$ pour acheter l'équipement nécessaire au voyagement et à la sélection de nouveaux cafés. Un mini-four à torréfaction pour échantillons, une machine à espresso portable, des quantités des meilleurs grains de café que nous pouvons dénicher exclusivement. Également pour développer la plate-forme d'abonnement en ligne pour les membres de notre club: afin de vous faire voyager dans le confort de votre maison!

L'impact

Nous souhaitons générer un impact positif dans nos communautés locales, partout à travers le pays, et chez nos producteurs de café d'exception, partout dans le monde :

1) Commerce direct

Nous travaillons à bâtir des relations durables avec nos producteurs. En éliminant les intermédiaires et en payant le juste prix, nous permettons aux familles de bien vivre et réinvestir dans leur ferme.

2) Développement durable

Pour enrichir la floraison des arbres Arabica, nos fermes productrices utilisent des engrais respectueux de la terre.

3) Emballage réutilisable et recyclable

Lorsque vous devenez membres du Club, vous adhérez à un code d'éthique pour agir positivement avec nos emballages tous réutilisables et recyclables afin de minimiser notre impact sur l’environnement.

4) Petit déjeuner pour un enfant

En achetant nos cafés, vous agissez aussi localement pour réduire les inégalités. Pour chaque sac vendu, nous offrons un petit déjeuner à un enfant dans le besoin.

5) Torréfaction locale artisanale

Fiers artisans de Montréal, nous travaillons fort pour vous offrir le juste équilibre dans nos torréfactions dans le but de respecter le produit et d'en maîtriser les saveurs.

6) Découvertes dans chaque sac

Nous travaillons à créer des expériences de contenus stimulantes, vous permettant d’avoir une connexion avec nos producteurs et suivre les retombées positives chez nous.

 

Les défis

Le risque de notre modèle d'affaires est basé sur l'abondance d'offre en café présentement, et beaucoup de cafés qui se positionnent comme offrant un produit de ""qualité"". L'art de torréfier artisanalement un café n'est pas donné à tous, et nous sommes persuadés qu'avec les cafés d'exception Traffic que nous emmènerons chez vous, chaque membre pourra goûter la différence. C'est donc dire que nous aurons beaucoup d'éducation à faire et d'activations. Également, le risque environnemental des changements climatiques est toujours très présent et menace d'éradiquer la variété Arabica de la planète, ce qui met en danger le café de qualité. Chez Traffic, nous nous efforçons de travailler avec des fermes qui optent pour des pratiques éco-responsables de développement durable.

Un déjeuner à un enfant pour chaque sac vendu

Pour chaque sac de café vendu, nous donnons un petit-déjeûner à un enfant dans le besoin. C'est notre façon de redonner dans notre communauté, et de faire une différence. Nous voulons agrémenter les matins des adultes en fournissant un café exceptionnel qui vous fera partir la journée du bon pied. Nous voulons jouer le même rôle chez nos jeunes, les adultes de demain. #TrafficForChange

Vous aimez notre projet ?
Merci de partager sans modération!
http://trafficcoffee.com

 

-----

Our Needs

We need 25 000$ to buy the necessary equipment to source and roast our exceptional coffees. More specifically, a sample roaster and a portable espresso machine. In addition, these funds will help us source exclusive high quality coffees in direct trade with global producers . Your funding will help us build our on-line membership platform for you, our members.

The impact

We want to make a positive impact in our local communities, across the country, and among our outstanding coffee producers around the world:

1) Direct Trade

We aim to develop long term relationships with our producers everywhere on Earth. By working directly with the farmers and paying a fair price for their quality product, we ensure these families can make a comfortable living and reinvest in their farms.

2) Sustainability

To make sure their Arabica trees provide the best coffee possible, our producers are using organic fertilizers and have strict policies in regards to sustainability.

3) Responsible Packaging

Once you join our Club, you support environmental values. All of our packaging is reusable and recyclable, to ensure we have the least impact possible on our environment.

4) Breakfast for kids in needs

When you support Traffic, you will also make a positive impact in your community. For every coffee bag we sell, we provide a breakfast to a local child in need.

5) Local Micro Roasting

As proud crafters from Montreal, we work hard to offer you the best roasts possible for our beans. The care we put into our product allows you to discover all the flavors exceptional coffee has to offer.

6) Each Bag is an Adventure

ATraffic strives to create visual experiences, allowing you to make the connection between our producers and the positive impact you make at home.

 

The Challenges

There are many risks in launching a coffee company
column2: the abundance of competitors in the market is a definitely challenge. A lot of coffee roasting companies position their brands as roasting ""high-end"" coffees, which is not the case. The art of micro-roasting exceptional coffees is not simple, and that is what we will be bringing into your home. You will taste the difference, we guarantee it. The environmental risk is also there, as the Arabica variety is in danger if we don't change something in the way we treat the planet. Traffic Coffee Club is working solely with farmers who have strict environmental and sustainability policies.

column1:
Provide a breakfast to a child in need

For each bag of coffee we sell, we provide a breakfast to a child in need. Traffic Coffee Club strives to upgrade your mornings and make sure you start your day on the right foot. We want to have the same role with children, tomorrow's generation. #TrafficForChange

You love our project ?
Share the love!
http://trafficcoffee.com

Delicious Innovation

We are launching a new specialty coffee roasting company offering a rotating selection of single origin, and micro-lot coffees, as well as unique and interesting blends for espresso, and filter brewers presented in 100% biodegradable, “nothing-to-remove” packaging. The proprietary plastic substitute keeps coffee extremely fresh, and then breaks down in the presence of microbes in landfills, or in the ocean. 
We want to show you how good coffee can be. Not just that it tastes better, but better for your community, and better for the environment.
Listen Up Jacksonville Locals!!!

If you live in Jacksonville or happen to be in town and would like to avoid shipping costs, just choose the ""Donate"" option instead. Once you have placed your order we will contact you via email or phone to arrange pick up or delivery for free!!
Your Order Will Be FulFilled

For this campaign you don't have to worry about us meeting our funding goals. Young Buck is already funded, and will be shipping orders as they come (roasting about once per week). Our main goal is to get as much coffee in your coffee pots as we can during this promo period! Because, guess what? Prices won't be this low again!
What You Get

Today, and for a limited time, we are giving you the opportunity to try our specialty coffees at a discounted price. Looking for a perfect gift for a friend or loved one? Just buying for yourself this year? Young Buck Coffee makes a perfect indulgence! PreSale ends December 15th (Sale Been Extended to January 10th). 
All pre-sale orders will be roasted within 48 hours of shipping. Perk levels include:
<ul>
• YBC Custom Vinyl Stickers
• $10 Level: Roaster's Choice (1 - 12oz bag)
• $20 Level: 2 - 12oz Bags
• $30 Level: 3 - 12oz Bags
• $40 Level: 4 - 12oz Bags
• $50 Level: 5 - 12oz Bags
• $70 Level: 7 - 12oz Bags (Our entire coffee lineup)
Help Us Launch
We believe more people should know they have a better choice with specialty coffee. Contributing to our PreSale helps in a number of ways:
<ul>
• You're helping us get on our feet. The proceeds from this launch will cover initial costs of operating such as roasting equipment, 100% biodegradable packaging etc.
• You're voting 'YES' to another business that cares about the environment and the contributions we all make with our purchases.
• You're keeping plastics out of the ocean and landfill with every purchase.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, no problem! You can still help us get the word out by sharing our campaign and following us on The Instagrams @youngbuckcoffee to stay up to date with future progress!

Summary.
Peanut butter: We’re nostalgic for it. Crack open a jar of peanut butter and BAM! Childhood is back!
On a sandwich, on some crackers, or straight off the spoon. Eating peanut butter is like inviting your childhood back in for a visit.
But did you know peanut butter can be shockingly unhealthy? Grab a jar from your pantry and look at the nutrition label. Surprised? Sugar, additives, preservatives, and chemicals.
We need​ to do better.

That’s where we come in. We are Natura and we believe that peanut butter can and should become something more than what it is. Something that we can snack on guilt-free, something that tastes delicious but is also as healthy as a bag of pure, roasted peanuts.

To that end, we've researched and developed Natura as a food product that uses the best natural ingredients to produce the best flavors we love and the healthfulness we need. Natura will produce the first Moringer Honey peanut Butter and eight other flavors including maple, crunchy, granola, cinnamon, honey, raisin, blueberries and strawberries
100% Natural

Made of 100% natural ingredients sourced in the USA, Natura is reliably wholesome. No chemicals. We believe food should consist of nothing but food. This may seem like common sense to you, but for many firms in the food industry, food is rarely just food. A large number of food products contain chemicals that no human should consume.
Nothing with the Natura label will ever contain chemicals.
Non-GMO

Our peanut butter is non-GMO, unlike the laboratory-tainted food products cluttering most grocery store shelves these days. For those of us who prefer to eat foods grown without​that technology, Natura offers an alternative peanut butter. Natura is bucking the trends that have persisted in the food sector for long enough. We are breaking out. We are making Natura the way that peanut butter should be.
Always Healthy, So Many Spreads
No trans fats
No added sugar
No preservatives
No Palm oils
Vegan
And Natura tastes wonderful!
At launch, we are introducing a series of flavors for our peanut butter, including:
• Peanut Butter Spread with Honey
• Peanut Butter Crunchy
• Peanut Butter Classic Creamy
• Peanut Butter Spread with Moringa  and honey
• Peanut Butter Spread with strawberry
• Peanut Butter blend with coconut
• Peanut Butter blend with dates
<ul>
• Peanut Butter Spread with Maple Cinnamon
• Peanut Butter Spread with Cinnamon Raisin
• Peanut Butter Spread with Caramel Apple Pie
• Peanut Butter Spread with Maple
• Peanut Butter Spread with Chocolate Chips
We are also launching two almond butter flavors: Almond Butter Classic and Almond Butter Spread with Honey.
We have researched and developed these flavors. Now, we need your help bringing them to market.
What We Need &

We need your help to raise the funds needed to produce, market, and distribute the initial flavors of Natura. Our fundraising goal for this campaign is $15,000, which will cover all of getting this groundbreaking peanut butter brand up and running. Any funds raised over this goal will be used for promotion and marketing.
And now the fun part! We are offering some exclusive rewards in exchange for your contributions, including early access to Natura. Be the first to try Natura!
Risks &
The timeline that we have is as follows:

May to July, 2021 – Indiegogo  Campaign Concludes

July, 2021 – First Orders

August, 2021 – Ship Pre-Orders

We are confident we can stick to this timeline, but delays are always possible due to unforeseen circumstances. However, we are committed to remaining 100% transparent and will keep contributors updated on our progress.

One More Way to Help

One more favor? After choosing the reward that is right for you and making your friends and family on social media? Every share will bring us that much closer to our goal!

We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about our plans.

Warm regards

Romain Voufo

","Summary.
Peanut butter: We’re nostalgic for it. Crack open a jar of peanut butter and BAM! Childhood is back!
On a sandwich, on some crackers, or straight off the spoon. Eating peanut butter is like inviting your childhood back in for a visit.
But did you know peanut butter can be shockingly unhealthy? Grab a jar from your pantry and look at the nutrition label. Surprised? Sugar, additives, preservatives, and chemicals.
We need​ to do better.

That’s where we come in. We are Natura and we believe that peanut butter can and should become something more than what it is. Something that we can snack on guilt-free, something that tastes delicious but is also as healthy as a bag of pure, roasted peanuts.

To that end, we've researched and developed Natura as a food product that uses the best natural ingredients to produce the best flavors we love and the healthfulness we need. Natura will produce the first Moringer Honey peanut Butter and eight other flavors including maple, crunchy, granola, cinnamon, honey, raisin, blueberries and strawberries
100% Natural

Made of 100% natural ingredients sourced in the USA, Natura is reliably wholesome. No chemicals. We believe food should consist of nothing but food. This may seem like common sense to you, but for many firms in the food industry, food is rarely just food. A large number of food products contain chemicals that no human should consume.
Nothing with the Natura label will ever contain chemicals.
Non-GMO

Our peanut butter is non-GMO, unlike the laboratory-tainted food products cluttering most grocery store shelves these days. For those of us who prefer to eat foods grown without​that technology, Natura offers an alternative peanut butter. Natura is bucking the trends that have persisted in the food sector for long enough. We are breaking out. We are making Natura the way that peanut butter should be.
Always Healthy, So Many Spreads
No trans fats
No added sugar
No preservatives
No Palm oils
Vegan
And Natura tastes wonderful!
At launch, we are introducing a series of flavors for our peanut butter, including:
Peanut Butter Spread with Honey
Peanut Butter Crunchy
Peanut Butter Classic Creamy
Peanut Butter Spread with Moringa  and honey
Peanut Butter Spread with strawberry
Peanut Butter blend with coconut
Peanut Butter blend with dates
Peanut Butter Spread with Maple Cinnamon
Peanut Butter Spread with Cinnamon Raisin
Peanut Butter Spread with Caramel Apple Pie
Peanut Butter Spread with Maple
Peanut Butter Spread with Chocolate Chips
We are also launching two almond butter flavors: Almond Butter Classic and Almond Butter Spread with Honey.
We have researched and developed these flavors. Now, we need your help bringing them to market.
What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to raise the funds needed to produce, market, and distribute the initial flavors of Natura. Our fundraising goal for this campaign is $15,000, which will cover all of getting this groundbreaking peanut butter brand up and running. Any funds raised over this goal will be used for promotion and marketing.
And now the fun part! We are offering some exclusive rewards in exchange for your contributions, including early access to Natura. Be the first to try Natura!
Risks & Challenges
The timeline that we have is as follows:

May to July, 2021 – Indiegogo  Campaign ConcludesJuly, 2021 – First OrdersAugust, 2021 – Ship Pre-OrdersWe are confident we can stick to this timeline, but delays are always possible due to unforeseen circumstances. However, we are committed to remaining 100% transparent and will keep contributors updated on our progress.One More Way to HelpOne more favor? After choosing the reward that is right for you and making your friends and family on social media? Every share will bring us that much closer to our goal!We appreciate all your support, both monetary and non-monetary, and we thank you for taking the time to read about our plans.Warm regardsRomain Voufo",7.0,0,"1 Campaign

Mira Mira Coffee

We are a neighborhood cafe in the heart of Savannah's growing art district, Starland. We are sisters who originally grew up in Washington State with an early and deep love of coffee, community, and music. Jessica is the artist with SCAD roots and is passionate about cultivating art and music in the city she convinced Amy to relocate to, not only to be close to family, but to experience the unique beauty and curiosity of our port city.
After being here for almost a decade, we joined forces in the pursuit of adapting a space at the corner of 34th and Habersham St into a thriving neighborhood space.

Our goal is to expand on our coffee equipment, put the finishing touches on art and a mural, expand our hours, and expand what we can offer our neighborhood. This campaign will give us the ability to hire passionate people and provide a committed space for art, music, and creators. We are committed to working with local vendors and partnering with local companies, like Cup to Cup as a coffee roaster. We currently work with a local BBQ operation to offer a delicious lunch and dinner options with neighborhood friendly prices. We hope to expand into breakfast and brunch through this campaign.
Campaign Goals:
<ul>
• The funding goal is $15,000 for an espresso machine, inventory, and expansion into 7 days a week of operations

• The perks we are offering include locally printed apparel and coffee, we're working on sourcing diner mugs and coffee to-go cups to add later, as well as gift cards valued more than the original perk
• All of the artwork and designs are done by SCAD students and local artists
• All of the printing is from a local screen printing shop
• The mural will empower a local artist

• When we reach our goal, we will be able to offer the neighborhood a place to study and work remotely, as well as a meeting place, a presentation place, and opportunity for artists to showcase their art and music
<h3>Risks &amp

With rebranding a space and brining in a new team and new direction, we have laid the foundation and consistency to grow, but need your help to get there. We have our launch team in place and have been operating for 3 months under our structure and brand. Our small team is committed to core values that include quality, compassion, and fostering a place for creativity.
<ul>
• To complete our space, we need to bring in more coffee options and expand into earlier hours
• We have local roasters who are excited for our expansion and are already committed to starting to do new coffee cuppings and events with us
• If we don't reach our complete goal, we will start with bringing in more robust coffee equipment and an espresso machine

• The ability to offer a professional and bright space for students and remote workers to come to daily is our primary goal, we already have strong wi-fi and a lot of long window, bar and low seating with built-in USB and outlets every couple feet.
• We're ready for you!
Other Ways You Can Help
If you love what we're doing, but cannot afford to contribute, you can still help by:
<ul>
• Sharing our campaign through your social media and telling your friends about what we're doing
• Indiegogo has sharing tools to make it even easier for you to help us get the word out!
